summary: A hot dog is a popular food made of a sausage served in a cut-open bun. It's usually grilled or boiled and often topped with mustard, ketchup, or relish. You can also add other toppings like onions, chili, or cheese. Hot dogs are sometimes called wieners or franks, named after their German origins. They became a favorite street food in the United States, especially at baseball games, and have different styles across the country. The hot dog is a classic American dish with its own fun traditions and contests.
title: Hot dog
